website_summaries.verdict: The HP Photosmart C6380 is a good fit for beginning photographers who want more than just a simple printer. Its six-ink cartridge bay, and scanning and copying capabilities extend its versatility, and while the output quality suffers a few missteps, the C6380 remains a worthwhile deal for the money.
cons: Output quality will not satisfy professional photographers

customer_reviews.title: Poor printer
customer_reviews.text: i bought this printer based on a consumer reports recommendation. Unfortunately this computer does not live up to the review. The photos were the real downfall of this printer. The photos printed very dark for some reason and I had to do major adjustments to get them to print well. It did take a while for the printer to print, the ink ran out quickly, if you refill your cartridges you get all kinds of annoying messages and it says they are empty so you have no idea how much ink is in each cartridge. This is my first experience with hp printers and it hasn't been good. I'm weary about trying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. Scanner and printer are both very efficient. The photos that I have printed look fantastic. I have not used the copy function yet. I've been unsuccessful with getting the product to work wirelessly, but that may be due to user error. I've gotten an error message a couple of times that states that the software needs to be reinstalled, but after restarting the printer/computer, it works fine. Again, that may be a problem related to my computer or user error rather than the fault of the printer/software. None of the problems have been so pervasive that they warrented time lost waiting for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Aw BB

customer_reviews.title: Avoid This Thing Like the Plague
customer_reviews.text: How far HP has fallen. This has been the most frustrating and irritating hardware I have ever used. Turn it on and you must wait what seems an eternity for "printer preparation" just to print one page. If you want to print a second page, this "printer preparation" starts all over again. Same thing making copies. Every copy requires printer preparation before it will start. Every time I try to use it I hate it more and more. Now, it's going to recycle center, and good riddance.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Wenning

customer_reviews.title: What a great printer
customer_reviews.text: I got the printer in the mail today. Installation was very easy, took about 20 minutes total. I had a HP 3210 which was billed as the fasted photo printer in the world at the time, this one is faster. Ink cartridges are very simple to install and not very expensive ($10 for the color and $12 for black, photo black is $10 also) . Installed the printer on 3 laptops through the wireless feature no problems installing on any of them. The only thing that would have made it better would have been a fax built in too.
customer_reviews.author: HunnyBunny

customer_reviews.title: What a rip off !!!
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked the printer and set it up. Turned it on and then went through the sets needed to connect it to my computer. After initializing, it was supposed to print an alignment page. This printer made so much noise when it tried to pick up the paper it was unbearable. It was never able to feed the paper through, let alone print. I did not return it because it cost more to return it than I paid for it in the first place. What a waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful easy to use printer
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a single problem with this printer...the photos it prints are great, the XL cartridges are fairly inexpensive and last a decent amount of time (I wouldn't even waste my time with the normal capacity ones). The scanner it great, the copy machine is adequate for home use and everyday (low quality-mostly text) printing is really fast. The wireless setup takes a little time, but was much easier than I thought it would be. For the price (I found it for $85 new!) This is an awesome printer that far surpasses my old photosmart that cost 6 times as much!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for wireless capability - it's just ok. Clunky, slow and loud.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an economic wire-free solution to printing, and although the setup was relatively easy (but took long to download, even from cd), the wireless connectivity works only ok and is spotty. It is extremely loud and always needs to warm up before any printjob (and takes forever to). Printing is slow and it uses up ink like no tomorrow. I expected better from HP.
customer_reviews.author: katana

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend it unless all you do is print photos
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, printed a beautiful test photo but is sooooo noisy. After printing each page, there was 10 seconds of clunking, ratcheting, etc. Manual two sided printing - no duplex printing - a minus in my opinion. If all you do is scan photos and print them and you can stand the noise, then this might be the three-in-one for you - provided there are no light sleepers in your household.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase, but...
customer_reviews.text: My HP Photosmart C6380 was delivered quickly. The installation was very simple and the printer works great. However, future purchasers should be made aware that the HP software significantly slowed the boot-up of my computer - adding about 40 seconds. After Googling some techie forums, I found out the HP start-up routine includes some scanning that is unnecessary for most applications. I was able to disable that portion of the start-up with the info I found - but it couldn't be done from the HP Preferences or Device Settings menus. It has to be done from the PC Startup menu. My PC now boots up normally. Despite this frustrating configuration problem, I am happy with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Just Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little bit confusing, but after figuring how to do it wireless it was just too simple. It is totally wireless for all 3 computers that I have. Pictures come out beautiful. I like the fact that I have separate colors which makes a savings for me for buying ink. You just have to buy what you actually are running out of. It's even easy to fax pages from this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Great print quality, but very noisey
customer_reviews.text: Overall: The printer quality and features beat my expectations. I bought it becaise it is wireless and had a seperate photopaper drawer; however it is the noiseyest all-in-one I have ever owned. Much grunting. Ink: The number of pages per cartridge is overstated, but I have found there is not much differance printing photos in "normal" as opposed to "best". Wireless: You must know basic wireless knowledge and how a router works. This is not for the novice. The direction are good, but if you do not understand domains and IP addressing please become informed before installing.
customer_reviews.author: Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: It is simply an incredible printer. The set up is straight forward and simple. The features are incredible including clear scans, beautiful and proffesional quality photos, quick printing, useful card reader, and you can even edit your photos and make fun free projects on the computer. I will never go with anything other than an HP again. I have not however used it wirelessly although it does have the capability.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: A great printer for my at home business! Heavy duty, prints quickly. A little loud, but I don't mind. UPDATE: This is the best printer ever! I have now had it for almost 2 years and have never had a paper jam, or any other problem for that matter. This printer is a workhorse! I print anything and everything in the course of a week: photos, stickers for postage, and the church bulletin. It all prints great. When this one finally does give in, I will buy another just like it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Scan software was buggy. Had to set my screen graphics resolution to be compatible with it. Ugh! Ink is expensive and runs through it fast. Will often not recognize remanufactured ink as being anything but empty - even when full. Has ink expiration date where a catridge becomes useless. Trust me, pass this one by.
customer_reviews.author: Y.M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Product works great most of the time. We are using the wireless feature and it has a habit of going offline quite a bit though and you have to go through the process of getting it back online. Pictures print great, and everything prints a lot faster than my old 750xi. It is definitely worth the money though!!
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Lost Scans but Printing looks good
customer_reviews.text: The printing seems pretty typical but if you have this wirelessly connected it sometimes loses scans which can become VERY irritating. Several times now I have run through a stack of documents mindlessly switching them out, readjusting where to scan, letting it save the file, moving to the next document. Then I finish and select "done" at which this is the first point the documents transfer to the computer. It's after 45 minutes of scanning that I find I am missing 1/4 to 1/2 of my scans! I could click "done" after every few scans but then I would need to re-open the software each time and start scanning. Why is this so dysfunctional?
customer_reviews.author: M. Leuner

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product at a terrific price point
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very nice purchase. I paid $99 with free shipping, and received the item in 2-3 days. I am very impressed with the quality of the printer, and would recommend it to anyone. I purchased this model as the result of reading a Consumer Reports review, which said that it was the best model for the price point of under $150. Easy setup, high quality printing, at a bargain of a price. How can anyone go wrong with a situation like that? Kudos to Amazon and HP!
customer_reviews.author: S. Deremer

customer_reviews.title: Consumer reports was right on - this unit is great
customer_reviews.text: This printer is everything Consumer Reports said it would be. A good basic printer/scanner/copier with out a lot of nonimportant bells and whistles. Its on screen menus are quite clear and photo printing is easy even with the computer turned off. All in all a very good device at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great personal office machine
customer_reviews.text: Great personal office machine. It prints quickly with great quality. I use the scan to memory drive feature regularly, as well. The only issue I had was the black ink cartridge ran out rather quickly. I am trying the XL version to see how much it improves.
customer_reviews.author: Tree

customer_reviews.title: I bought this unit when Windows no longer supported an ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit when Windows no longer supported an old HP scanner. It works well as long as you keep feeding it new ink cartridges. It still serves as an all-in-one, but now instead of being a printer - scanner - copier, it is a scanner - paper weight - boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Slambo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this printer as a gift so I am not completely sure how the owner likes it, except to say that I have heard no complaints. I did set up the printer for use, and it was no problem at all. I was not aware of the number of individual print cartridges, but I am sure this has to do with the high quality of photo printing. Don't know if the scanner function has been used. As far as printing and copying goes, the HP6380 spits out quality quick.
customer_reviews.author: chly000579

customer_reviews.title: HP C6380 Review
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer on the recommendation of a friend. I found it at Staples for $214.00 with tax. I got it on Amazon for $159.00 delivered. It is fast, easy to use and prints outstanding photos! The delivery was very fast and I love dealing with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Austin

customer_reviews.title: It's a printer...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do., networking it isn't hard if you hook it up to your wireless router via eithernet. Print heads are a bit loud, but it does a good job and when you print out pictures they turn out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Drebeesie

customer_reviews.title: Comparison Between the 3210and 6380
customer_reviews.text: My 3210 malfunctioned, so I may get it repaired. But meantime, I went to a local office supply store to se what was available. The salesperson showed me the 6380 and told me that even though the 6380 ink cartridges were much smaller than the ink cartridges for the 3210, they lasted much longer. Well, either he lied, or he was misinformed. I can't believe how fast the 6380 sucks up the ink compared to my 3210 printer! Given the sizes of the two cartridges, it makes sense that the larger ones last longer, in spite of what that guy told me. Jack
customer_reviews.author: Jack R. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: Nice features, modern styling. Once you get a network printer, you'll never go back to USB (if it works!). Software/firmware are too buggy, unintuitive, slow, bloaty. Took 10 minutes to get working on macs, about 20 minutes on PCs. Ink tanks go fast.
customer_reviews.author: DMJ

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is good. I don't use my printer regularly so I haven't printed a lot of material yet. It does take a long time to warm up each time it's turned on, hopefully it's not using up all the ink in start-up preparation! I bought this printer because I thought it was the best printer for the price, easy to use and functionally it met all my current needs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: I had big time problems with this model. I called the manufacturer and they sent me a different model which works better. I would not recommend this model to anyone. Manufacturer said they had problems with this printer. If they had problems with this printer I don't know why they kept selling it.
customer_reviews.author: otis

customer_reviews.title: Work on the noise
customer_reviews.text: Easy and versitle printer and scanner, wireless setup is simple, and can be wired or wireless on each computer. My only complaint is the noise from this unit, both in pre print start up and after the print, why?
customer_reviews.author: holson

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but the wireless doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer and the photos are high quality and better than Wal-Marts. Ufortunately, the wireless wouldn't work with 2-wire routers .... so if you have SBC for DSL and use their free router the printer has to be hooked up via USB.
customer_reviews.author: VolleyballDad

customer_reviews.title: hp all in one not so all in one
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new imac and now have discovered that this hp product which i bought for the imac is not comptabile in its scanning function. since this is a major reason why I bought it,i am irritated and disappointed. must it be caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Quataert

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Photographic prints (4X6 and 8X10) have been near professional in quality. Original set-up (wireless mode) was daunting, but not through any lack of clarity in directions, rather my inexperience. Available technical assistance was invaluable. Operation is a bit noisy, but finished output is superior. An excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ruhe

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned it because it did not print very good. Smeary
customer_reviews.author: Melissa J. Mcginnis

customer_reviews.title: Super Buy
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted in a printer. Really fast shipping. Easy set up and works great. Would highly recommend this item for price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: No More HP's
customer_reviews.text: Bought the HP C6380 in May 2009. This is a printer that does not get much use, however, enough where it seemed to suck up ink at a rate I've never seen before in a printer. A little more than a month ago, it started with print error messages and after much research, cleaning, research, we decided to scrap it and try another brand. There won't be any further HP purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Al Duska

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Time!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spent the last three hours working with HP support trying connect my MacBook to my new HP Printer with no success. The printer is so poorly made, pressing a single button on the panel makes the rest of the buttons shake too. Boxing this crap up for immediate return. Waste of time in every way!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Malibu CA

customer_reviews.title: HP
customer_reviews.text: If it from this company Logitech you have no problems just plug it in and use it
customer_reviews.author: W. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Ink Cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you order XL replacement cartridges, they actually do last longer. Great printer, noisy, but no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ron O.

customer_reviews.title: C6380
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this printer. wirless feature a huge pluss, and very easy to set up. The only downfall if it is one is that its very nosiey. I highly recomend this printer for all its features and print quaility!
customer_reviews.author: J. Krok

customer_reviews.title: HPPhotosmart C6380 AIO
customer_reviews.text: Great high quality printer that works wireless and does everything. Beautiful photo printing and graphics printing. Good on cartridges at a reasonable prince.
customer_reviews.author: Graphics Geek

customer_reviews.title: HP All In One Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is our second HP All in One. It set up easily, and performs well in all modes: printing, scanning, and copying. Our first HP All in One is still performing well after three years of use. This model,C6380 is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Bad printer
customer_reviews.text: In my over 30 years I don't think I have used a noisier and slower printer. This thing goes through ink faster than you can water your flowers. Even the old dot printers was not as nosey as this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Huey

customer_reviews.title: surprise surprise
customer_reviews.text: new printer set up and excited to print a picture! it won't print from my computer you have to download the picture you want to print to a flashdrive and then you can print a picture....not what I would call convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy used
customer_reviews.text: The one I bought was used, I wouldn't buy a used one again as it wasn't long before it developed problems. However, it did an excent job up to that point.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Murray

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointing experience
customer_reviews.text: I used it for half a year. It's a piece of junk. I can only use as B/W printer, the colors are never right.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir A.

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-One printer
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend this printer, printed material is very easy to read as characters are very sharp. Colors are very clear and brilliant when printing photos. We are very satisfied with this printer and would recommend it, particularly for home use. We would purchase through Amazon again as this order was handled promptly and satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A great Printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great and the white color is wonderful. It is so much better looking then the ones that HP is putting out this year. I would buy it again for just the looks alone. The Negative is that like all the HP Printers I've owned, it chews up lots of ink and HP does not seem to know how to make a new printer without it using a different size ink cartridge then they have ever used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Honest-29

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Not to familiar with computers and found that this printer was very easy to hook up and use. Terrific price on a real work horse. Beautiful color prints. Couldn't be happier and enjoy HP brand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Janke

customer_reviews.title: HP Fan
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a white and silver wireless printer to match my laptop and mouse, this one is perfect. I've been an HP fan for years, so when I found this I knew it was the one, plus it had very good reviews. Very easy set up, it is a little jerky and makes noise but the print quality is excellent, my photos look great. The separate tray for photo paper is a definite asset.
customer_reviews.author: lpenning

customer_reviews.title: best choice ever..!!!
customer_reviews.text: The printer was everything I was wishing for.... too bad the HP discontinue this model, I think was too good for this price ...
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo O. Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: The setup was easy and the product performs better than I expected. So far there have been no problems and I would recommend it for most users.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: rating photosmart 3600
customer_reviews.text: It took me quite a while, and some outside help, to figure out how to find my scans once I had made them. (It wasn't really difficult, just different from what this old lady was used to!) Therefore I haven't used the machine a great deal, but I think it's going to be fine and maybe super-fine.
customer_reviews.author: Meesha

customer_reviews.title: Set up
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for setting up the printer were not completely clear. In addition HP did not supply a USB cord to connect the printer to the computer which I thought was really cheap of them considering the amount customers had to pay for the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up and works great wirelessly. The pictures are photo quality and the text printing is fast. The scanner works great also. Very crisp scans. The print cartridges that comes with it are small, but the full size ones last a long time with high quality photo printing. Very Happy!
customer_reviews.author: R. McIntire

customer_reviews.title: why is it so expensive now?
customer_reviews.text: i bought this printer for $99 4 years ago... but why is it 300+ now?!?! what the heck? this is nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the biggest pile of junk to ever occupy space on top of my desk. Always had good luck with HP, after countless hours, could not get it to work or be recognized in any of my 3 computers. All I get is that either the computer does not recognize the hardware or on my desk top a dreaded blue screen every time I try to connect. Have tried to load software 6 ways to Sunday, downloaded all the HP updates. Right now this never used device is headed to the dumpster. Never another HP product or another purchase from Amazon!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W. Milek

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart C6380 All-in-One Printer
product_meta.description:
HP Photosmart C6380 All-in-One Printer

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description The HP Photosmart C6380 All-in-One Compact Color Inkjet Printer, Copier, And Scanner is capable of printing at speeds of up to 33 ppm in black & white and 31 ppm in color. Enjoy freedom from messy cables and wiring with the C6380's built-in Wi-Fi and optional Blue tooth capabilities. The C6380 is also capable of printing up to 8.5 x 11-inch borderless photos that feature vivid color and stunning 9600 x 2400 dpi resolution from supported memory cards or PictBridge compatible digital cameras.

 

The HP Photosmart C6380 offers:  * The ability to Print, Copy, and Scan 
 * Print and copy speeds up to 33 ppm black & white and 31 ppm color 
 * Built-in Wi-Fi and optional Blue tooth capabilities 
 * High-resolution color prints of up to 9600 x 2400 dpi 
 * A 125-sheet paper tray and 20-sheet photo tray 



The HP Photosmart C6380 is a compact multifunction printer. View larger. 

Aa color preview screen makes it easy to print directly from memory cards. View larger. Print Crisp, Colorful Photos and Image-Rich Documents
Not only does the HP C6380 print colorful photos and documents at speeds reaching as high as 31 ppm, but it also makes the quality of the imagery a priority, with its use of HP Vivera Inks and five-color ink process that produces lap-quality photos and laser-quality text. With the HP C6380, you can print directly from a variety of supported memory cards, including CompactFlash, Memory Sticks (Duo), SD Card, SDHC Card, MMC,xD-Picture Cards. No need for the computer; just plug-in a compatible memory card and use the colorful 2.4 inch LCD screen to help guide you through the printing process, or just plug in your PictBridge digital camera to print directly.

 Wireless Networking Made Easy
Hp is a leader in wireless printing, and they make it easy to configure your wireless network. The C6380 features built-in 802.11 b/g Wi-Fi connectivity for networking laptops and desktop computers to a single printer without having to use messy cables, and HP's step-by-step instructions will guide you through this simple process. 

 Color Copy and Scan With Ease
The C6380 features easy one-button copying in both black & white and full-color with ultra-high resolution of up to 600 x 600 dpi and 9600 x 2400 dpi respectively. It will make as many as 50 copies with the push of a button at speeds of up to 33 cpm in black & white and 31 cpm in color. Reduce or enlarge originals from 50% to 400% for added versatility.

 You get a full-color preview of your scan before you actually decide to scan the document, which can be as large as 8.5 x 11.7 inches in size. Once you decide to scan, it will be quick; it takes a matter of seconds to produce full-color images up to 4800 dpi in dynamic 48-bit color. Use the included software to enhance a scanned image or document to an unbelievable 19,200 dpi for producing large-scale prints and digital documents.

 Versatile Paper Handling
This printer will handle a variety of special media, including cards, envelopes, transparencies, and photo paper at sizes as large as 8.5 x 14 inches. The C6380 comes equipped with a 125-sheet paper tray and a convenient 20-sheet photo tray.

 Compatible with both Windows (including Vista) and Macintosh, the HP Photosmart C6380 measures 17.79 x 15.97 x 8.17 inches (WxDxH) and weighs 16.4 pounds. It's backed by a 1-year limited warranty that includes phone support.

 What's in the Box
HP Photosmart C6380 All-in-One Printer, power cord, power supply, print head assembly, HP 564 black cartridge (approx. 250 pages), HP 564 photo black cartridge (approx. 130 photos), HP 564 cyan, magenta, and yellow cartridges (approx. 300 pages each), software, media sample pack, set-up and basics guides.

 


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer 

Connect your home wireless1 network to the HP Photosmart C6380 and print lab-quality photos, laser-quality documents, crisp copies, and stellar scans—all with a single, reliable machine. 

HP—THE LEADER IN WIRELESS PRINTING
 * Print without cords; transmit documents from laptops plus desktop PCs and Macs1, or use wired networking
 * Do it all with one machine: print, scan, and copy
 * Print without a PC using the 2.4" color display and memory card slots
 * Print photos without swapping paper—the photo tray automatically engages

HIGH-QUALITY PRINTING
 * Consistently get laser-quality text and lab-quality photos with the five-ink system
 * Get instantly dry, smudge-resistant photos when using HP Vivera ink and Advanced Photo Paper
 * Print lab-quality photos that last for generations2 when using HP Advanced Photo Paper
 * Print exactly what you see onscreen with HP Smart Web Printing3
 * Replace the five economical individual ink cartridges only as each runs out


SUPER SPEEDS
 * Print and copy fast, at up to 33 pages/min black and up to 31 color4
 * Print a 4 x 6" photo in as little time as 18 seconds4





PEACE OF MIND
 * Protect your investment with the one-year limited warranty plus our Total Care advice and support
 * Rely on us: our printers were chosen by consumers as the easiest to use5
 * Get questions answered toll-free, 24 x 7, or via e-mail in as little time as an hour—at www.hp.com/go/totalcare
 * Get exclusive offers and discounts on supplies, shop from your own supplies list, and get free next-day shipping with "My Print Rewards" 

1. Wireless performance depends on physical environment, distance from access point.
2. Display-permanence rating by Wilhelm Imaging Research Inc. or HP Image Permanence Lab.
3. Requires Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 or higher.
4. After first page.
5. Based on worldwide consumer research in 2006 by Millward Brown.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?


• Printer • Power cord • Power supply • Print head assembly • HP 564 black cartridge (approx. 250 pages) • HP 564 photo black cartridge (approx. 130 photos) • HP 564 cyan, magenta, and yello cartridges (approx. 300 pages each) • Software • Media sample pack • Set-up and basics guides 

See more
feature_bullets: Compact 3-in-1 color inkjet printer that prints, scans, and copies
Print crystal clear color photos up to 9600x2400 dpi
Ultra-fast printing speeds as high as 33 ppm
Built-in Wi-Fi allows for wireless printing
Measures 17.79 x 15.97 x 8.17 inches (WxDxH); weighs 16.4 pounds; 1-year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars269 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
